channel.title: One Square Meter
channel.description: A year-long biodiversity documetation of 1m² area in Gundmi, India.

item.title: Sighting: Sword-tail Cricket
item.description:
Sword-tail Cricket (Trigonidium cicindeloides)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Crickets are cool, they sit still.

Weather: 29.6°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Planthopper
item.description:
Planthopper (Metadelphax propinqua)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Look at the details on it. It is very small, hard to spot.

Weather: 29.6°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Green Lacewing Larva
item.description:
Green Lacewing Larva (Chrysopidae Sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

This time it is carrying trash! Also known as trash bug.

Weather: 29.6°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Jumping Spider
item.description:
Jumping Spider (Salticidae sp)

Category: Arachnid | Season: Winter

I casually took the picture of the flower, only to see the tiniest of the spiders! Very gool guy. He was quite busy.

Weather: 29.1°C, Overcast

item.title: Sighting: Green Lacewing Larva
item.description:
Green Lacewing Larva (Chrysopidae Sp)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

I saw a blob of cotton walking around! Reminded me of Howl's castle. Cool bug!

Weather: 29.1°C, Overcast

item.title: Sighting: Greenfly
item.description:
Greenfly (Myzus persicae)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

This is a new one. Never seent these before.

Weather: 29.1°C, Overcast

item.title: Sighting: Lynx Spider
item.description:
Lynx Spider (Oxyopes salticus)

Category: Arachnid | Season: Winter

What a kill! Lynx spiders don't web, they just attack!

Weather: 29.1°C, Overcast

item.title: Sighting: Long-legged Fly
item.description:
Long-legged Fly (Condylostylus sipho)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Green, shiny, sits still.

Weather: 29.1°C, Overcast

item.title: Sighting: Thrips
item.description:
Thrips

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Very small. No idea what species it is. Casually took the photo of the flower, and was surpised to see the life moving on it!

Weather: 29.3°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Black Dump Fly
item.description:
Black Dump Fly (Hydrotaea aenescens)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Oh to be a fly on the grass...

Weather: 28.9°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Leafhopper
item.description:
Leafhopper (Orosius sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Small, very pretty patterns that I only found out after zooming into the photo. ~ 2mm in lenth

Weather: 29.4°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Rust Fly
item.description:
Rust Fly (Psilidae Sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Small fly, ~ 2mm in length

Weather: 29.4°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Planthopper
item.description:
Planthopper (Metadelphax propinqua)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Its head looks like a tiny helment!. Small in size, ~2 mm in length may be.

Weather: 29.4°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Flea Beetle
item.description:
Flea Beetle (Chaetocnema sp.)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Tiny, but very shiny. ~ 1.5 mm in length.

Weather: 29.4°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Sighting: Banded Pearl
item.description:
Banded Pearl (Sameodes cancellalis)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Biggest insect yet!

Weather: 29.4°C, Partly cloudy

item.title: Week 1: Not bad!
item.description:
My knees hurt.

Hello!

So, end of the week (well, just 4 days)! 20 species found, from very tiny to slightly bigger ones!

I saw 3 new hoppers that I hadn't seen before. They are tiny!

So, the morning light is not enough to get good quality photos, I have to bump up ISO, which leads to very grainy images. Looks like I will spend monies on a flash. Sigh.

My macro photography skills have rusted. I am hoping it will get better as the time goes on.

I also discoverd a very similar project done before by Chris Helzer. Read about it here. The photographs he has taken are very clean and precise! Now I have a benchmark to aim for!

One week at a time!

item.title: Sighting: Lynx Spider
item.description:
Lynx Spider (Oxyopes salticus)

Category: Arachnid | Season: Winter

I like these ones. They sit still!

Weather: 27.6°C, Overcast

item.title: Sighting: Wolf Spider
item.description:
Wolf Spider (Pardosa milvina)

Category: Arachnid | Season: Winter

Very common. Hard to spot unless they move.

Weather: 27.6°C, Overcast

item.title: Sighting: Flower Moth
item.description:
Flower Moth (Eretmocera impactella)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

After many attempts of blurry images due to low light, when I just about to get a good pic, an ant showed up and scared this moth away.

Weather: 27.7°C, Slight rain showers

item.title: Sighting: Yellowish Planthopper
item.description:
Yellowish Planthopper (Conomelus anceps)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

Small hopper. It sat still for a while under some shade. Must invest in a flash.

Weather: 27.7°C, Slight rain showers

item.title: Sighting: Fruit Flies
item.description:
Fruit Flies (Euaresta bella)

Category: Insect | Season: Winter

This one stood still enough to get a okayish record shot, but had to bump up the ISO for a faster shutter. Noisy pic.

Weather: 27.7°C, Slight rain showers

item.title: Day one!
item.description:
So it begins.

Hello world!

Welcome to a square meter project, here we like bugs. Find more about the project in the about section.

Today, I set up the fence posts on 4 corners of the patch, cleaned up the space a bit, placed an old wood piece in it. That is it. No more fiddling with the patch for the rest of the year.

My first immediate dilemma is this:

If I spot a bug within the square meter but it moves out of the boundary before I can get a photo, should I still take the picture and count it as a sighting, or should I let it go?
